definition: to drift without a resting place (idiom)/roving/errant/vagrant/erratic
to set/to fix/to determine/to decide/to order

sentences.english: Why did she describe herself as feeling “adrift”?
sentences.chinese: 为什么她描述自己感觉“飘忽不定”呢？

sentences.english: Thoughts may go exotic night souls, in the open on the Makino erratic.
sentences.chinese: 思绪似异域夜走的魂灵，在空旷的牧野上飘忽不定。

sentences.english: Her alcoholic mother drift edinandout of her life.
sentences.chinese: 她酗酒的母亲在黛登的生活中荡进荡出，飘忽不定。

sentences.english: Gust of wind blowing, rain sway, the scene also seems to.
sentences.chinese: 阵风吹来，雨帘晃动，雨中之景好像也在飘忽不定。

sentences.english: Listening to it, often feels erratic cloud came between.
sentences.chinese: 听着它，往往感觉来到了飘忽不定的云间。

sentences.english: I would miss my loving, erratic, harebrained mother.
sentences.chinese: 想念我亲爱的飘忽不定，粗心大意的妈妈。

sentences.english: Boys and girls like it when the soul of a daze, erratic, to come and go without a trace.
sentences.chinese: 它就像少男少女发呆时的灵魂，飘忽不定，来去无踪。

definition: to oscillate without pause (idiom)/to fluctuate/(of thoughts) to wander/to waver
intermittent/now you see it, now you don't
to fathom/to make sense of/to grasp
come without a shadow, leave without a footprint (idiom); to come and leave without a trace
variant of 飄渺|飘渺[piao1 miao3]
hard to tell if it's real or sham
lit. to appear and disappear unpredictably like a spirit or a ghost (idiom)/fig. elusive
unreal/illusory/imaginary/vague and with nothing in it
